page.title: 14PIGEON BREEDING IN HAUGHTON.
page.content: The members of Bunbury Homing Society breed their own pigeons and take great interest in improving the strain and therefore the birds performance. Two of our fanciers race in National races which are a great test for the birds. Clear water and fresh corn are provided daily and much care must be given to the pigeons' loft,especially cleanliness, correct lighting and heating. The sexes must be separated except in the breeding season and young birds must also be kept separ- ately after weaning. They must be given regular flying time and have to be tossed away from home in prep- aration for races, to develop muscle and the homing instinct. Prizes are awarded within the club and the federation. Pigeon racing is a sport for all ages and raises a lot of money for charities.
